programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: The Rangers can flex their muscle in Game 2 of an East quarterfinal against the Capitals. Matt Rempe opened the scoring as New York rolled to a 4-1 win in Game 1. Igor Shesterkin (NYR) has allowed two goals or fewer in 10 straight home playoff games.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: The Jets try to keep rolling 7s as they host the Avalanche in Game 2 of their first-round playoff series. Winnipeg scored a 7-6 victory in Game 1 after winning at Colorado 7-0 on April 13. The Jets' Adam Lowry scored twice in each of those affairs.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: The Maple Leafs and Bruins see their tied first-round set shift to Canada for Game 3. Auston Matthews scored the go-ahead goal with under eight minutes remaining in Toronto's 3-2 win over Boston in Game 2, and finished with three points on the night.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: Mark Stone and the Golden Knights square off against the Stars in Game 2 of their West first-round series. Stone, playing for the first time since Feb. 20 because of a lacerated spleen, scored the first goal as Vegas held off Dallas 4-3 in Game 1.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: College GameDay
programme.desc: Originating from the site of one of the day's best matchups, with a sea of fans cheering wildly in the background, host Rece Davis and analysts Lee Corso, Kirk Herbstreit and Desmond Howard talk college football for three hours, reporting on the top teams, games, players and storylines. David Pollack and Maria Taylor contribute reports, interviews and features. Davis replaced longtime host Chris Fowler in 2015.

programme.title: NFL Draft Countdown
programme.desc: Countdown to the NFL Draft.

programme.title: 2024 NFL Draft
programme.desc: A panel of analysts break down the picks teams make in the 2024 NFL draft in Detroit, the 89th annual event.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: "NBA Countdown" serves as the primer for game telecasts on the ESPN family of networks. It's highlighted by a lively roundtable discussion and debate of the top storylines around the league. Seats at the table are reserved for folks in ESPN's stable of NBA hosts and analysts, with the latter group imparting wisdom based on their many years of playing experience.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Eastern Conference First Round, Game 3.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: The Panthers try to take a 2-0 lead over the Lightning in their East first-round series. Florida prevailed 3-2 in Game 1 in a contest that included 109 hits. Sam Reinhart scored Florida's first goal after collecting 57 during the regular season.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: The Canucks roll into Game 2 of a first-round series against the Predators. Vancouver flipped the script in the third period of Game 1 with two goals in 12 seconds to take the lead en route to a 4-2 win. Dakota Joshua (VAN) scored twice in the frame.

programme.title: In the Crease
programme.desc: Post-game analysis and highlight show airing each night throughout the NHL season from Barry Melrose and Linda Cohn.

programme.title: Good Guy/Bad Guy
programme.desc: The ex-champion of the two divisions of the UFC Daniel Cormier and former MMA fighter Chael Sonnen talk about their passion shared by MMA and the rest of the sport world.

programme.desc: The Hurricanes rage into Game 3 of their East first-round series against the Islanders. Carolina scored the final five goals in a 5-3 victory in Game 2 for its first three-goal comeback in the postseason since 2006, when it won the Stanley Cup.

programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: ESPN Sports Betting Analysts Erin Dolan and Joe Fortenbaugh, along with host Tyler Fulghum, break down the biggest storylines through the lens of sports betting, with breakdowns, discussions and picks.

programme.title: United Football League
programme.desc: A Lone Star State matchup between winless clubs pits the Roughnecks against the Renegades. Arlington quarterback Luis Perez has tossed for a league-leading 737 passing yards to go with four touchdown throws. Houston fell 34-20 to Michigan in Week 3.

programme.desc: After a razor-thin finish in Texas, the NASCAR Xfinity Series runs the Ag-Pro 300 at Talladega. Sam Mayer's last-lap pass at the Andy's Frozen Custard 300 gave him a .002-second margin of victory over Ryan Sieg, who was after his first series win.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Bucks carry a 1-0 advantage into Game 2 of their first-round series against the Pacers. Milwaukee overcame the absence of Giannis Antetokounmpo to take Game 1, 109-94. Pascal Siakam led all scorers with 36 points for Indiana in the loss.

programme.title: Inside the NBA
programme.desc: This Emmy Award-winning studio show, which airs following each NBA telecast on TNT, is hosted by Ernie Johnson, with analysis from Hall of Famer Charles Barkley and NBA champions Kenny Smith and Shaquille O'Neal. It's a mix of highlights, interviews and hijinks, notably the verbal sparring sessions between the outspoken Barkley and his straight man, Smith. The show also welcomes various guest analysts throughout the season.

programme.title: #Handles
programme.desc: Lauren Jbara and Channing Frye engage with X, Facebook and Instagram, sharing a social recap of the NBA's top highlights and storylines.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: Las últimas noticias, momentos destacados e información de todos los rincones del mundo del deporte se presenta cada día en "SportsCenter", el primer programa de ESPN cuando la red se estrenó en septiembre de 1979. La serie se transmite en tres ediciones nocturnas, luego se re-transmite la última edición cuatro veces cada mañana de lunes a viernes antes de despejar el escenario para un bloque de seis horas de "SportsCenter" en vivo, que pone más énfasis en la interactividad de los fanáticos, noticias, análisis, comentarios y la cobertura de las conferencias de prensa.
